decision_conditions: It is recommended that this Beech tree T1 as shown on the Havering TPO plan 22/05 can be overall crown reduced to previous pruning points and by up to 1.5m towards the property, from the tip to an inter-nodal branch break to leave the tree balanced, to include crown thinning by 10%.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out to the standards detailed in British Standard Document BS 3998:2010.
To ensure that the work is carried out in accordance with good arboricultural practice.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out as an overall reduction, so that the tree's crown remains balanced.
To ensure that the tree's stability is maintained and in the interests of public amenity.
The work for which consent is granted shall be carried out within 2 years from the date of this consent.
To prevent the accumulation of consents.
description:
Tree type - Beech Tree 

Location - Rear of property 22 parkway 3 m for property alongside property boundary 
Description of work - reduce by 1 m from the tip of previous pruning points and 1.5 m towards the property to an internodal branch break to leave the tree balanced - crowned thinned up to 10% 
work will be carried out in accordance to to BS 3998:2020
